nodes.title: I.1. Residential Structures Occupying Summits: Fortresses, breastworks, religious buildings, palaces, and related edifices
General site characteristics
nodes.body: The once large citadel of mkhar lung mkhar gog is situated on a ridge-top more than 400 m above the GarSgar valley. It is one of a chain of archaic strongholds occupying lofty locations above the arable GarSgar valley.35 The castle commands excellent views of the GarSgar valley, especially to the north and east, and enjoys a defensibly tenable position. Castle Valley Ruined Castle is found above the right side of the Kharlung ChuMkhar lung chu, in proximity o where it debouches into the main valley. This was an extensive complex composed of a cluster of small buildings built with cobble walls. The dispersion blankets an area of 190 m along the axis of the hill (north-south) by 13.5 m to 30 m (east-west). A count of wall footings indicates that this site consisted of around 100 rooms and/or buildings. Most structures have been reduced to their foundations or low-lying wall fragments. The high elevation of this site and style of construction, whereby tiny rooms predominate, are archaic cultural horizon situational and morphological traits.
